text.title: Prepare Yourself for the Week Ahead

p.s: Do you find that your weekday evenings are absolutely absorbed by going to the gym , ferrying around the kids , catching up on chores , and more ?
Make things easier for yourself by taking time at the weekend to alleviate the midweek pressure .

item.s: Do your food shopping online .

Most leading supermarkets offer a deliver-to-your-door service that cuts out the hassle of roaming around a massive food outlet , crammed with hungry shoppers ( unless , of course , you live in the middle of nowhere ) .
Before buying anything , plan out your every meal for the week .
From this list of recipes , collate all the ingredients you will need .
By ordering online , you can save time and money ( no impulsive , in-store purchases of chocolate ice cream at 9pm ) .

figure.rend: Prepare Yourself for the Week Ahead Step 1.jpg

item.s: Make meals ahead of time .
You can make every single meal you need for the week on Sunday , but this can be a messy and tiring operation .
A more time-effective tactic is to make the most of your appliances , such as your blender and your slow cooker .
For these meals , you will only need to cut up your fruit and vegetables in advance , freeze , and then throw them together for a breakfast smoothie or main meal .
Pinterest has some fantastic inspiration , so it ’s worth doing some research .

figure.rend: Prepare Yourself for the Week Ahead Step 2.jpg

item.s: Do the big cleaning jobs .
Definitely do n’t spend your entire , precious weekend scrubbing every nook and cranny of your kitchen , but get the big jobs out of the way , like cleaning out your microwave or treating your sink .
You can always perform small maintenance jobs throughout the week , but you do n’t want these tasks piling up on you when your time is short .
Who can face tackling the oven after a long day at work and a difficult session in the gym ?

figure.rend: Prepare Yourself for the Week Ahead Step 3.jpg

item.s: Make room for treats and personal projects .
Whatever you ’ve got in store for your week , make time to do the things you enjoy the most .
That could be watching your favourite programme with a tall glass of wine or picking up on an on-going , creative project .
When outlining your weekly routine , be sure to allow for an hour of relaxation time for yourself .

figure.rend: Prepare Yourself for the Week Ahead Step 4.jpg

item.s: Create your schedule .
This can be a tedious process , but it ’s possible to make it fun , too !
It may help to make your schedule as public as possible – that means investing in a white board or painting yourself a chalkboard wall !
Unlike a diary , you ca n’t ignore this beacon of reminders .

figure.rend: Prepare Yourself for the Week Ahead Step 5.jpg

item.s: Manage your weekly closet .
Hopefully you ’re up-to-date with your laundry .
If you are , that means you can create your weekly closet !
Assemble your daily outfits on hangers marked with the days of the week , and iron what needs ironing .
Pre-bag your gym kits ( if you need them ) and lay out your nightwear .
This will allow you an extra ten minutes or so in bed !
